Interface BestFoodManagerInterface


  • public interface BestFoodManagerInterface
    Specifies the methods required for the restaurant ranking data manager
    Author:
    ralexander

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Restaurant[][] getBestRestaurants()
      Gets an array of Restaurants sorted by rating within each category
      java.lang.String[] getCategories()
      retrieves the category names (e.g., Mexican, Thai, etc)
      Restaurant[][] readFromFile(java.io.File inFile)
      Reads from a file with one line per food category and a set of restaurant names and ratings.
      void setBestRestaurants(Restaurant[][] rdata)
      Sorts each row of restaurants in rdata according to its rating, from highest to lowest ratings.
      void writeToFile(java.io.File outFile)
      Writes the sorted set of restaurants to a file, with a header, in the following format: Categories; Best Restaurants in Rockville; Average Rating Mexican; Taco Bar; Tortacos; Al Carbon; El Mariachi; 4.05

    • Method Detail

      • readFromFile

        Restaurant[][] readFromFile(java.io.File inFile)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Reads from a file with one line per food category and a set of restaurant names and ratings. For each name/rating pair a Restaurant object is created and added to the 2D array of restaurants. A 1D array of categories is also created and held in the manager instance
        Parameters:
        inFile - of type File containing 8 lines of text in the following format: Category;Restaurant Name: Rating; Restaurant Name: Rating; Restaurant Name: Rating; Example: American (Traditional);Coastal Flats: 4.0;Quincy's South: 4.5; Note that each line of text may contain a different number of restaurant/rating pairs
        Returns:
        a 2D array of restaurants, each row being of a single category
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if inFile is not found or not readable

      • setBestRestaurants

        void setBestRestaurants(Restaurant[][] rdata)
        Sorts each row of restaurants in rdata according to its rating, from highest to lowest ratings. This sorted array is held by the manager instance.
        Parameters:
        rdata - the 2D array of restaurants read in from the input file.

      • getBestRestaurants

        Restaurant[][] getBestRestaurants()
        Gets an array of Restaurants sorted by rating within each category
        Returns:
        the sorted 2D array of Restaurants

      • writeToFile

        void writeToFile(java.io.File outFile)
          throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Writes the sorted set of restaurants to a file, with a header, in the following format: Categories; Best Restaurants in Rockville; Average Rating Mexican; Taco Bar; Tortacos; Al Carbon; El Mariachi; 4.05
        Parameters:
        outFile - the file that will be written to
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • getCategories

        java.lang.String[] getCategories()
        retrieves the category names (e.g., Mexican, Thai, etc)
        Returns:
        a 1D array of Strings that contain the category names
